column4: U.S. government to sue JPMorgan in mortgage case: sources
column5: The U.S. Justice Department is preparing to sue JPMorgan Chase & Co over mortgage bonds it sold in the run-up to the financial crisis  a sign the bank's legal troubles are not yet over.

column4: KKR returns to China's dairy industry with CDH  Modern Dairy venture
column5: HONG KONG KKR & Co LP  is leading a joint venture that plans to invest $140 million in two large dairy farms in China  said a person with direct knowledge of the matter  as the private equity firm returns to the fast-growing sector.

column4: S.Korea to decide on $7.7 bln jet tender: Boeing or nothing
column5: SEOUL  Sept 24 Boeing Co is favourite to win one of the world's biggest defence deals of the year on Tuesday when South Korea names the winner of an 8.3 trillion won ($7.7 billion) fighter jet tender  with its F-15 Silent Eagle the only candidate within budget.

column4: Mastercard  Visa to cut French card fees -watchdog
column5: PARIS  Sept 23 Mastercard and Visa  have agreed to cut the fees to process credit card transactions in France by almost half.

column4: Merck says FDA concerned about aspects of drug study
column5: Merck & Co Inc said on Monday that health regulators are concerned about operational aspects of a hypersensitivity study for sugammadex  an injection designed to reverse the effects of muscle relaxants used by anesthesiologists during surgery.

column4: Americans say they're creatures of simple  solo exercise habits

column4: Nielsen wins U.S. OK for Arbitron deal  with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON Television ratings giant Nielsen Holdings NV won U.S. antitrust approval on Friday for a $1.3 billion deal to buy Arbitron Inc  a company that dominates radio ratings measurement.

column4: Monte Paschi seeks to halt Nomura's London court action
column5: LONDON Italy's Monte dei Paschi di Siena  asked a London court on Monday to stay or dismiss legal action by Japan's Nomura  over risky derivatives trades that got the Tuscan bank into deep trouble.

column4: Richemont hires advisor for Lancel sale: Bloomberg
column5: PARIS/ZURICH Swiss luxury goods group Richemont  has hired investment bank Nomura  to advise on a possible sale of luxury leather goods brand Lancel  according to a Bloomberg report and French press on Monday.

column4: Larry Ellison juggles America's Cup and Oracle customer expo
column5: SAN FRANCISCO The 34th America's Cup underway on San Francisco Bay is going on longer than Oracle Team USA backer Larry Ellison expected and is now overlapping with his software company's massive annual customer conference.

column4: Powerful Oracle moves a step closer to keeping America's Cup
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Oracle Team USA moved a step closer to keeping the America's Cup on Monday  winning the day's only race and yet again preventing challenger Emirates Team New Zealand from clinching the trophy.

column4: UPDATE 1-Sailing-Powerful Oracle moves a step closer to keeping America's Cup

column4: Sailing-Weather threatens to postpone America's Cup showdown  again
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 23 Light wind on San Francisco Bay threatened on Monday to delay a showdown in the America's Cup  with a once-formidable Emirates Team New Zealand struggling to regain an edge to take the trophy from increasingly confident defender Oracle Team USA.

column4: Linux distributor Red Hat's billings growth disappoints
column5: Red Hat Inc  the world's largest commercial distributor of the Linux operating system  reported a slower growth in billings than analysts had expected.

column4: Southern Copper  Anglo American could partner on Peru mine
column5: LIMA  Sept 23 Two of the world's top copper producers  Anglo American and Southern Copper  are talking about teaming up to develop Anglo's $3.3 billion Quellaveco mega mine in Peru  Southern Copper's chief executive said on Monday.

column4: Telefonica strengthens grip on Telecom Italia: source
column5: MILAN Spanish telecoms company Telefonica  has agreed to hike its stake in rival Telecom Italia   a source close to the deal said  ending months of speculation on the future of the debt-laden Italian group and opening the way to asset sales.

column4: Telefonica agrees to up indirect stake in Telecom Italia-source
column5: MILAN  Sept 24 Spain's telecoms group Telefonica  has reached an agreement to raise its stake in Telco  the holding company that controls Telecom Italia  to an initial 65 percent with an option to bring the stake to around 70 percent  a source with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Italy minister says hard to force telecom network spin off
column5: ROME  Sept 23 An Italian junior minister said on Monday it would be difficult for regulators to force Telecom Italia  to hive off its fixed line network  something that had been suggested by Italy's telecoms authority.

column4: Italy telecoms regulator should consider imposing network spinoff

column4: Britain awards 1.5 billion pound smart meter contract to Telefonica
column5: MADRID The British government has awarded a further contract as part of its multi-billion pound smart meters program  designed to link electricity and gas meters to supplier systems in a network that could cut bills and create jobs.

column4: Record numbers switch mobile operator in Spain
column5: MADRID  Sept 23 A record number of mobile phone users in Spain switched service providers in July  hitting big operators such as Telefonica as the recession spurred customers into looking for cheaper deals  according to new figures published on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 3-No big foreign telecoms in Canada auction  boosting domestics
column5: OTTAWA  Sept 23 Major foreign telecommunications companies have decided against registering for a Canadian wireless spectrum auction  in a setback for the government's plans to introduce more competition into the mobile telephone sector.

column4: HBO  AMC take top Emmy awards  holding off Netflix
column5: LOS ANGELES While upstart streaming service Netflix Inc burst into the Emmy party this year  it was cable networks with the most to celebrate on Sunday night as HBO dominated and AMC grabbed the prestigious best drama prize for "Breaking Bad."

column4: TD Bank to pay $52.5 million in U.S. settlements over Ponzi scheme
column5: Toronto-Dominion Bank  will pay $52.5 million to settle U.S. civil regulatory charges that it failed to report suspicious activity in accounts linked to a Ponzi scheme by Florida lawyer Scott Rothstein  who is serving a 50-year prison term.

column4: Walmart holiday hiring to outpace U.S. retail industry
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Monday it plans to hire 55 000 temporary workers at its Walmart U.S. stores during the holiday season  up roughly 10 percent from 2012  as the world's largest retailer seeks to maintain its edge during a sluggish economic recovery.

column4: Walmart U.S. to hire more temporary holiday workers
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Monday it plans to hire 55 000 temporary staff to work at its Walmart U.S. stores during the holiday season  up roughly 10 percent from 2012  as it gears up for a competitive winter.

column4: Walmart to hire 55 000 temporary staff for holiday season
column5: Sept 23 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it would hire 55 000 temporary staff to work at its stores in the United States during the holiday season.

column4: Fake reviewers snared in NY Attorney General yogurt sting
column5: Sept 23 Nineteen companies caught writing fake reviews on websites such as Yelp  Google Local and CitySearch have been snared in a year-long sting operation by the New York Attorney General  and will pay $350 000 in penalties.
